abstract: Collapse of Health Republic Insurance of New York, health care co-op purporting to offer alternative to government-run plans, has left 200,000 people scrambling for health care coverage; closing, driven by cuts to government subsidies, low premiums and rising costs, offers cautionary tale to other faltering insurers.
lead_paragraph: Some New Yorkers who have the company’s health insurance policies said they were worried how they would pay medical expenses next month, after Health Republic closes on Nov. 30.

headline.main: New Yorkers Face Hard Decisions After Collapse of Health Republic Insurance
headline.print_headline: New Yorkers Face Difficult Decisions After an Insurer’s Sudden Collapse

snippet: Some New Yorkers who have the company’s health insurance policies said they were worried how they would pay medical expenses next month, after Health Republic closes on Nov. 30.
